Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst (Power BU)

Location: Pennsylvania, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Location: Etters, Pennsylvania Posted: 03/05/2024 Location Name: Etters, PA

Wage: Depends on Experience Annual Position Type: Full Time

Amphenol Corporation is one of the world's largest designers and manufacturers of electrical, electronic and fiber optic connectors and interconnect systems, antennas, sensors and sensor-based products and coaxial and high-speed specialty cable. Amphenol Communications Solutions (ACS), a division of Amphenol Corporation, is a world leader in interconnect solutions for Communications, Mobile, RF, Optics, and Commercial electronics markets. ACS has an expansive global presence in research and development, manufacturing, and sales. We design and manufacture a wide range of innovative connectors as well as cable assemblies for diverse applications including server, storage, data center, mobile, RF, networking, industrial, business equipment, and automotive.

At Amphenol Power Solutions, we are committed to leading the way in technology innovations around the world. Our advanced global network consists of state-of-the-art test labs, fully integrated manufacturing facilities and a globally staffed R&D team which gives us the ability to provide innovative and award leading designs for our customers. Amphenol Power Solutions Business Unit is a leading solution provider for Interconnect Power Solutions for Datacom, Telecom & Industrial Segments covering Tier 1 OEM customers globally

This Business Unit has currently manufacturing & engineering operations spread across China, India and USA. We are currently seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to join our team to support the growing ambitions of the Business. The Position will be in Etters, PA, USA.

This position is not eligible for Relocation or Visa Sponsorship. ***

Responsibilities 

Financial Forecasting and Reporting Liaise with operations and product management team to consolidate and report the weekly updates, monthly actuals, monthly forecasts and provide support for monthly operations reviewsBusiness AnalysisConsolidate customer orders, sales, and products to review and understand the current business environment.Provide Business Leadership team with business insights and analysisBudgeting and PlanningProvide support and input to the annual strategic planning & budgeting process.Building RelationshipsDevelop and enhance relationships with internal and external customers to achieve business unit goals and objectives.Variance Analysis:Investigate discrepancies between actual and forecasted performance.Suggest actions for improvement.Perform product & manufacturing operations margin reviews.Track and review headcount.Review cost of sales & manufacturing variances to understand key drivers.SG&A review and analysisCost Analysis and Cost Reduction:Deep Dive into product cost analysisAssist with cost-saving opportunities including product cost reduction efforts.Working Capital ManagementCoordinate, review, and track capital appropriation requests to ensure effective use of company funds.Inventory management (DSI / inventory turns review)Accounts Payable / Accounts Receivable managementProduct transfers:Assist and support product / product line transfers between manufacturing sites to align with customer requirements & business objectives.Ad Hoc Analysis:Co-ordinate with operations and business unit teams to provide responses to HQ / Group review questions in a timely manner.Respond to specific requests from management by conducting ad hoc financial analysis and reporting.
Education/Experience

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or related field (master's preferred)3+ years of current, relevant experience as a Financial AnalystStrong communication and interpersonal skillsStrong proficiency in financial modeling and data analysis.Ability to work independently as a self-starter.Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPointWorking knowledge of Power BI is desirable

Amphenol is an "Equal Opportunity Employer" - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
